title: Requests
description:
A popular and widely-used library for making HTTP requests in
 Python. It is simple to use and provides many convenient features, such
 as automatic decompression and connection pooling.

title: Pillow
description: A library for handling image files in Python, providing a wide array of image processing capabilities, including resizing, cropping, color manipulation, and filtering. Pillow supports many image file formats, including JPEG, PNG, BMP, and GIF. It is a powerful and flexible tool for working with images in Python, and is widely used in a variety of applications, from web development to scientific imaging.

title: OpenCV
description: Open Source Computer Vision Library is a popular, open-source computer vision and machine learning software library. It provides a comprehensive set of computer vision and machine learning algorithms, including support for image processing, object detection, image segmentation, and more. It is widely used in industry and academia for applications such as computer vision, robotics, and augmented reality, and is a popular choice for building computer vision applications due to its ease of use, extensive documentation, and large community of developers.

title: Mahotas
description: An open-source Python library for computer vision and image processing. It provides a set of fast and efficient algorithms for image processing tasks such as morphological operations, thresholding, and feature extraction, making it a useful tool for researchers and practitioners in the field.

title: Imageio
description: A library for reading and writing a variety of image file formats, as well as providing support for animations, video, and volumetric data.

title: Beautiful Soup
description: A library for parsing HTML and XML documents, it provides a way to extract and manipulate data from a web page, making it easier to obtain the information you need.

title: Scrapy
description: An open-source and collaborative web crawling framework, it provides an efficient and easy-to-use method for extracting data from websites.

title: Selenium
description: A browser automation library, it allows you to control a web browser and automate actions, such as clicking and scrolling, making it useful for web scraping.

title: TensorFlow
description: An open-source deep learning frameworks that is widely used for training and deployment of machine learning models. TensorFlow uses a static computational graph. This means that in PyTorch, the user can change the graph on the fly, while in TensorFlow the graph must be static and defined before the model is run.

title: PyTorch
description: An open-source deep learning frameworks that is widely used for training and deployment of machine learning models. Unlike other models, PyTorch uses a dynamic computational graph. This means that in PyTorch, the user can change the graph on the fly. PyTorch provides a more pythonic interface and easier to understand code.

title: MxNet
description: An open-source deep learning framework designed to be fast, scalable, and flexible, and can be used on a variety of devices, including cloud-based systems, mobile devices, and edge devices. The framework also offers a rich set of tools and libraries for implementing and deploying deep learning models, including support for computer vision, natural language processing, and recommendation systems.

title: Seaborn
description: A plotting library for creating static, animated, and interactive visualizations

title: Matplotlib
description: A library based on Matplotlib that provides a high-level interface for visualizing statistical relationships and producing publication-quality figures

title: Plotly
description: An interactive, open-source library for creating and sharing visualizations

title: Bokeh
description: An interactive visualization library that targets modern web browsers for presentation

title: Flask
description: A high-level framework for building complex, database-driven web applications.

title: Django
description: A high-level framework for building complex, database-driven web applications.

title: Pyramid
description: A more flexible framework that can be used for both small and large-scale web applications.

title: Tkinter
description: A built-in package that provides a simple way to create GUI applications with a minimal amount of code. Tkinter is a good choice for small and simple GUI applications,

title: PyQt
description: A comprehensive set of Python bindings for the Qt application framework and tools. PyQt is a comprehensive solution for creating more advanced GUI applications

title: wxPython
description: A set of Python bindings for the wxWidgets C++ GUI toolkit. wxPython is a good choice for cross-platform GUI development.

title: Dask
description: A library for parallel and distributed computing that can be used to process larger-than-memory datasets.

title: PySpark
description: A library for big data processing that provides a high-level API for distributed data processing using the Spark framework.

title: Modin
description: Modin provides a high-level interface for working with large datasets, similar to the popular data analysis library pandas. It aims to speed up the processing of large datasets by distributing the computations across multiple cores or even multiple machines. Modin works by transparently splitting the data into smaller partitions and processing each partition in parallel, allowing users to work with large datasets without worrying about the underlying details of parallel and distributed computing. Modin is designed to be highly compatible with pandas and can be used as a drop-in replacement for pandas in many cases, making it a good choice for those who want to scale up their data processing capabilities without having to rewrite their existing code.

title: aiohttp
description: An asynchronous HTTP client for Python, built for fast performance and high concurrency. It provides support for both client and server-side applications.

title: httpx
description: A modern HTTP client for Python, providing sync and async APIs, and supporting both HTTP and HTTPS. It is built on top of the asyncio library and offers fast performance and high concurrency.

title: Pygame
description: A popular and well-documented library for creating games in Python. It provides a comprehensive suite of tools for game development, including support for graphics, sound, and input handling.

title: Pyglet
description: A library for game and multimedia development in Python. It provides a high-level API for creating games and multimedia applications, and has a smaller and simpler API than Pygame.

title: Panda3D
description: A 3D game engine for Python, providing a complete set of tools for creating 3D games, including support for graphics, sound, and physics simulation.

title: Arcade
description: A 2D game development library for Python, providing an easy-to-use API for creating simple games and interactive applications.

title: cocos2d
description: A 2D game development framework for Python, providing a comprehensive set of tools for creating games, including support for graphics, sound, and input handling.

title: PyQuery
description: A library that allows you to make jQuery queries on XML documents, it provides a way to extract and manipulate data from HTML pages, and is similar in style to Beautiful Soup.
